sen.j: 和辻哲郎（わつじ てつろう、1889年3月1日 - 1960年12月26日）は、『古寺巡礼』『風土』などの著作で知られる日本の哲学者、倫理学者、文化史家、日本思想史家。
sen.e: Tetsuro WATSUJI (March 1, 1889 - December 26, 1960) was a Japanese philosopher, ethicist, cultural historian, and scholar of Japanese history of ideas who was well known for his literary works such as "Koji Junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) and "Fudo" (Climate and Culture).

Tetsuro WATSUJI (March 1, 1889 - December 26, 1960) was a Japanese philosopher, ethicist, cultural historian, and scholar of Japanese history of ideas who was well known for his literary works such as "Koji Junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) and "Fudo" (Climate and Culture).

Tetsuro WATSUJI (March 1, 1889 - December 26, 1960) was a Japanese philosopher, ethicist, cultural historian, and scholar of Japanese history of ideas who was well known for his literary works such as "Koji Junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) and "Fudo" (Climate and Culture).

sen.j: その倫理学の体系は、和辻倫理学と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The system of his ethics is known as Watsuji Rinrigaku (Ethics).
The system of his ethics is known as Watsuji Rinrigaku (Ethics).
The system of his ethics is known as Watsuji Rinrigaku (Ethics).

sen.j: 日本的な思想と西洋哲学の融合、あるいは止揚とでもいうべき境地を目指した稀有な哲学者と評価される。
sen.e: He is recognized as an unprecedented philosopher who tried to merge Japanese thoughts with Western philosophy and aimed at the sublate of those studies.
He is recognized as an unprecedented philosopher who tried to merge Japanese concepts with Western philosophy and aimed at sublating those studies.
sen.cmt: thoughts → concepts. The sublate of → sublating
sen.e: He is recognized as an unprecedented philosopher who tried to merge Japanese concepts with Western philosophy and aimed at sublating those studies.

sen.j: 主著の『倫理学』は、近代日本における独創性を備えたもっとも体系的な哲学書のひとつであると言われている。
sen.e: His major work "Ringigaku" (Ethics) is said to be one of the most systematic and original philosophy books of modern Japan.
His major work "Ringigaku" (Ethics) is said to be one of the most systematic and original philosophy books of modern Japan.
His major work "Rinrigaku" (Ethics) is said to be one of the most systematic and original philosophy books of modern Japan.

sen.j: 京都市長を務めた船舶工学者の和辻春樹は従弟に当たる。
sen.e: Haruki WATSUJI, an expert in marine engineering who was also appointed the mayor of Kyoto, is his cousin.
Haruki WATSUJI, an expert in marine engineering who was also appointed the mayor of Kyoto, is his cousin.
Haruki WATSUJI, an expert in marine engineering who was also appointed the mayor of Kyoto, is his cousin.

sen.j: 長女は尾高邦雄に嫁した。
sen.e: His eldest daughter married Kunio ODAKA.
His eldest daughter married Kunio ODAKA.
His eldest daughter married Kunio ODAKA.

sen.j: 現在、姫路市の主催で、和辻哲郎文化賞が毎年優れた著作に与えられている。
sen.e: Nowadays, Himeji City awards The Watsuji Tetsuro Bunka Sho (The Watsuji Prize for Culture) to excellent works every year.
Nowadays, Himeji City awards The Watsuji Tetsuro Bunka Sho (The Watsuji Prize for Culture) to excellent works every year.
Nowadays, Himeji City awards The Watsuji Tetsuro Bunka Sho (The Watsuji Prize for Culture) to excellent works every year.

sen.j: 1889年 兵庫県神崎郡砥堀村仁豊野（現・姫路市仁豊野）にて誕生。
sen.e: 1889: He was born in Nibuno, Tohori-mura, Kanzaki County, (present-day Nibuno, Himeji City), Hyogo Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「神崎郡（兵庫県）」とありますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「神崎郡」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: 1889: He was born in Nibuno, Tohori-mura, Kanzaki County, (present-day Nibuno, Himeji City), Hyogo Prefecture.
1889: He was born in Nibuno, Tohori-mura, Kanzaki County, (present-day Nibuno, Himeji City), Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: 1906年 旧制姫路中学（現・兵庫県立姫路西高等学校）卒業。
sen.e: 1906: He graduated from Himeji Junior High School (under the prewar education system), which is present-day Hyogo Prefectural Himeji Nishi Senior High School.
1906: He graduated from Himeji Junior High School (under the prewar education system), which is present-day Hyogo Prefectural Himeji Nishi Senior High School.
1906: He graduated from Himeji Junior High School (under the prewar education system), which is present-day Hyogo Prefectural Himeji Nishi Senior High School.

sen.j: 1909年 第一高等学校 (旧制)卒業。
sen.e: 1909: He graduated from First Higher School (under the prewar education system).
1909: He graduated from First Higher School (under the prewar education system).
1909: He graduated from First Higher School (under the prewar education system).

sen.j: 同年、後藤末雄、大貫晶川、木村荘太、谷崎潤一郎らとともに同人誌、第二次『新思潮』に参加、第一号に載せたのは戯曲「常盤」。
sen.e: In the same year, he participated in the second issue of a series of private magazines named "Shin Shicho" with Sueo GOTO, Shosen ONUKI, Sota KIMURA, and Junichiro TANIZAKI, and he wrote a drama named 'Tokiwa' for the first volume.

In the same year, he participated in the second issue of a series of private magazines named "Shin Shicho" with Sueo GOTO, Shosen ONUKI, Sota KIMURA, and Junichiro TANIZAKI, and he wrote the first episode of a drama named 'Tokiwa'.
sen.cmt: re-wrote the second part of the sentence.
sen.e: In the same year, he participated in the second series of private magazines named "Shin Shicho" with Sueo GOTO, Shosen ONUKI, Sota KIMURA, and Junichiro TANIZAKI, and he wrote a drama named 'Tokiwa' for its first issue.
sen.cmt: ＮＣの後半の訂正で意味が違ってしまったので書き直しました。second issue of a→second

sen.j: 以後も、ジョージ・バーナード・ショーの翻訳などをするが、次第に文学から遠ざかる。
sen.e: Subsequently, he was also involved in translation of books written by George Bernard Shaw, but he gradually lost interest in literature.
Subsequently, he was also involved in the translation of books written by George Bernard Shaw, but he gradually lost interest in literature.
Subsequently, he was also involved in the translation of books written by George Bernard Shaw, but he gradually lost interest in literature.

sen.j: 谷崎の才能に叶わないと感じたからだといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that was because he felt he was no match for Tanizaki in talent for literature.
It is said that was because he felt he was no match for Tanizaki in terms of talent for literature.
sen.cmt: in talent → in terms of talent
sen.e: It is said that was because he felt he was no match for Tanizaki in terms of talent for literature.

sen.j: 1912年 東京帝国大学文科大学哲学科卒業、同大学院進学。
sen.e: 1912: He graduated from Tokyo Imperial University, the College of Literature, the department of philosophy, and then entered the Graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 原文に「東京大学」とありますがリンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「東京帝国大学」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: 1912: He graduated from the department of philosophy in the College of Literature, Tokyo Imperial University, and then entered the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: Re-wrote the first par tof the sentence. Graduate → graduate. 原文に「東京大学」とありますがリンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「東京帝国大学」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: 1912: He graduated from the department of philosophy in the College of Literature, Tokyo Imperial University, and then entered the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: ケーベルを尊敬し、卒論を読んでもらいたいが為に英語で執筆。
sen.e: He respected Koeber, and he wrote his graduation thesis in English because he wanted this professor to read his thesis.
He respected Koeber, and he wrote his graduation thesis in English because he wanted this professor to read his thesis.
He respected Koeber, and he wrote his graduation thesis in English because he wanted this professor to read his thesis.

sen.j: 当初はニーチェ論を書きたかったが、指導教授が難色を示したためショウペンハウアーに関するものにした。
sen.e: He wanted to write about Nietzsche at first, but he eventually changed his theme to Schopenhauer because his academic adviser hesitated about his first theme.
He wanted to write about Nietzsche at first, but he eventually changed his theme to Schopenhauer because his academic adviser hesitated about his first theme.
He wanted to write about Nietzsche at first, but he eventually changed his theme to Schopenhauer because his academic adviser hesitated about his first theme.

sen.j: 同年、高瀬照と結婚。
sen.e: In the same year, he married Teru TAKASE.
In the same year, he married Teru TAKASE.
In the same year, he married Teru TAKASE..

sen.j: 阿部次郎との親密な交流が始まる。
sen.e: He became close friends with Jiro ABE.
He became close friends with Jiro ABE.
He became close friends with Jiro ABE..

sen.j: 1913年 紹介を得て夏目漱石の漱石山房を訪れるようになる。
sen.e: 1913: He began to visit Soseki NATSUME's Soseki Sanbo (a house where Soseki stayed in his later years) through an acquaintance.
1913: He began to visit Soseki NATSUME's Soseki Sanbo (a house where Soseki stayed in his later years) through an acquaintance.
1913: He began to visit Soseki NATSUME's Soseki Sanbo (a house where Soseki stayed in his later years) through an acquaintance.

sen.j: 『ニーチェ研究』を出版
sen.e: He published "Nietzsche Kenkyu" (Nietzschean Studies).
He published "Nietzsche Kenkyu" (Nietzschean Studies).
He published "Nietzsche Kenkyu" (Nietzschean Studies).

sen.j: 1916年 漱石および岳父高瀬三郎の死。
sen.e: 1916: Soseki and his father-in-law Saburo TAKASE died.
1916: Soseki and his father-in-law Saburo TAKASE died.
1916: Soseki and his father-in-law Saburo TAKASE died.

sen.j: この時期、日本の文化に深い関心を寄せ始める。
sen.e: During that period, he began to have great interest in Japanese culture.
During that period, he began to have great interest in Japanese culture.
During that period, he began to have great interest in Japanese culture.

sen.j: 1920年 東洋大学講師
sen.e: 1920: He assumed a Toyo University lecturer.
1920: He became a lecturer at Toyo University.
1920: He became a lecturer at Toyo University.

sen.j: 1922年 法政大学教授
sen.e: 1922: He assumed a Hosei University professor.
1922: He became a professor at Hosei University.
1922: He became a professor at Hosei University.

sen.j: 1925年 京都帝国大学助教授。
sen.e: 1925: He assumed a Kyoto Imperial University assistant professor.
1925: He became an assitant professor at Kyoto Imperial University.
1925: He became an assitant professor at Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 1927年 ドイツ留学。
sen.e: 1927: He went to Germany to study.
1927: He went to Germany to study.
1927: He went to Germany to study.
(stayed in Germany until 1928)
(stayed in Germany until 1928)
(stayed in Germany until 1928)

sen.j: 1931年 京都帝国大学教授。
sen.e: 1931: He assumed a Kyoto Imperial University professor.
1931: He became a professor at Kyoto Imperial University.
1931: He became a professor at Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 1932年 大谷大学教授兼務、文学博士号取得。
sen.e: 1932: He assumed an Otani University professor as well, and obtained a doctorate in literature.
1932: He became a professor at Otani University professor, and also obtained a doctorate in literature.
1932: He concurrently became a professor at Otani University professor, and obtained a doctorate in literature.
sen.cmt: ＮＣチェックで意味が違ってしまったので書き直しました。

sen.j: 1933年 東京帝国大学文学部倫理学講座教授。
sen.e: 1933: He assumed a professor at Tokyo Imperial University, the College of Literature, the department of ethics.
1933: He became a professor at the department of ethics in the College of Literature, Tokyo Imperial University.
1933: He became a professor at the department of ethics in the College of Literature, Tokyo Imperial University.
1949: He retired from the university.
1949: He retired from the university.
1949: He retired from the university.

sen.j: 日本学士院会員。
sen.e: He became a member of the Japan Academy.
He became a member of the Japan Academy.
He became a member of the Japan Academy.

sen.j: 1950年 日本倫理学会会長（死去まで）。
sen.e: 1950: He was appointed to be the president of the Japanese Society for Ethics (he had been at this position until his death).
1950: He was appointed as the president of the Japanese Society for Ethics (he remained at this position until his death).
sen.cmt: appointed to be → appointed as. had been → remained
sen.e: 1950: He was appointed as the president of the Japanese Society for Ethics (he remained at this position until his death.)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧内へ移動

sen.j: 1955年 文化勲章受章。
sen.e: 1955: He received a Cultural Medal.
1955: He received a Cultural Medal.
1955: He received a Cultural Medal.
1960: He died.
1960: He died.
1960: He died.

sen.j: 墓所は鎌倉の東慶寺にある。
sen.e: His graveyard is at Tokei-ji Temple in Kamakura.
His graveyard is at Tokei-ji Temple in Kamakura.
His graveyard is at Tokei-ji Temple in Kamakura.

sen.j: 留学中、ハイデッガーの『存在と時間』に示唆を受け、時間ではなく空間的に人間考察をおこなったもの。
sen.e: He contemplated human beings in terms of space instead of time, inspired by "Being and Time" written by Heidegger during his stay in Germany.
He perceived human beings in terms of space instead of time, inspired by "Being and Time" written by Heidegger during his stay in Germany.
He perceived human beings in terms of space instead of time, inspired by "Being and Time" written by Heidegger during his stay in Germany.

sen.j: 1931年に刊行。
sen.e: This book was published in 1931.
This book was published in 1931.
This book was published in 1931.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後、盛んになった日本文化論の先駆的な作品ともいえる。
sen.e: This book is regarded as a pioneering work of discussions about Japanese culture, which became lively after World War II.
This book is regarded as pioneering work of discussions about Japanese culture, which was revived and became popular after World War II.
sen.cmt: became lively → was revived and became popular
sen.e: This book is regarded as pioneering work of discussions about Japanese culture, which became popular after World War II.
sen.cmt: was revived and→削除（revived ではありません。）

sen.j: 風土をモンスーン（日本も含む）、砂漠、牧場に分け、それぞれの風土と文化、思想の関連を追及した。
sen.e: He classified climates into a monsoon (including Japan) group, a desert group, or a farm group in order to examine relations between each climate, culture, and thought.
He classified climates into groups, namely, monsoon (including Japan), desert, or farm in order to examine the relations between the various climates, culture, and human thinking.
He classified climates into groups, namely, monsoon (including Japan), desert, or farm in order to examine the relations between the various climates, culture, and human thinking.

sen.j: 『風土』の中に見られる「風土が人間に影響する」という思想は、悪しき環境決定論であるという批判や、天皇制肯定論になっているという批判がある。
sen.e: His idea that "climate should affect human begins," which is seen in "Fudo," is exposed to some criticisms; for example, some people think that his idea is bad environmental determinism or that it leads to affirmation of the emperor system of Japan.

His idea that "climate affects human begins," which is seen in "Fudo," has been exposed to some criticisms; for example, some think that his idea is a poor environmental determinism or that it leads to affirmation of the emperor system of Japan.
sen.cmt: Re-wrote the first part of the sentence.
sen.e: His idea that 'climate affects human begins,' which is seen in "Fudo," has been exposed to some criticisms; for example, some think that his idea is a poor environmental determinism or that it leads to affirmation of the emperor system of Japan.

sen.j: 一方、この風土という考え方こそがグローバリゼーションをとどめるための積極的な方法論である、とする評価（オギュスタン・ベルク）もある。
sen.e: At the same time, some people such as Augustin Berque appreciate his idea and believe that this way of thinking based on climate must be a positive methodology which can stop globalization.
At the same time, some people such as Augustin Berque appreciated his idea and believe that this concept based on climate must be a positive methodology that can stop globalization.
sen.cmt: way of thinking → concept. Which can → that can.
sen.e: At the same time, some people such as Augustin Berque appreciated his idea and believe that this concept based on climate must be a positive methodology that can stop globalization.
